docs.text: Hello world! Photo taken at Oct. 13th, 2018 Hello, I am Sanghoon Kim, master candidate at KAIST , majoring in computer science. I am interested in SE (Software Engineering) and HCI (Human-Computer Interaction). More specifically, my research interest includes human-centric service computing, pervasive computing, IoT, and related issues in HCI. My advisor is In-Young Ko, and my research group is Web Engineering and Service Computing Lab. My e-mail address is: seiker (AT) kaist.ac.kr Here is my CV (quite outdated!) : CV_201902.pdf Education Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology Sep. 2019 - Present M.S. candidate in School of Computing, KAIST Ulsan National Institute of Science and Technology Mar. 2015 - Aug. 2019 B.S. magna cum laude in Electrical and Computer Engineering Majored in Computer Science and Engineering, minored in Management Engineering Overall GPA 3.78 / 4.3, Major GPA 3.99 / 4.3 Available Languages English : Business-level conversation available TEPS score: 714/990 (Valid until Dec. 03, 2019) TOEFL score: 84/120 (Valid until Feb. 02, 2021) Experiences Internship at Next-generation Embedded / Computer System Software Technology Lab. , UNIST. Sep. 2016 - Aug. 2017 Studied briefly about Linux kernel, distributed computer & storage systems, and flash memory & FTL (Flash Translation Layer). Internship at Interactive Visual Analysis & Data Exploration Research Lab. , UNIST. Jan. 2018 - May 2019 Participated in a project which helps developers to design and prototype mobile application in iterative process. C. Lee, S. Kim , D. Han, H. Yang, Y. Park, B. C. Kwon and S. Ko, TBA Participated in a project which aims to help user's decision among multiple coordinated charts and visualizations. Domestic Exchange Student to SNU , South Korea. 2016 Summer semester (Jun. 2016 - Aug. 2016) 2016 Winter semester (Dec. 2016 - Feb. 2017) International Exchange Student to HKUST , Hong Kong. 2018 Summer semester (Jun. 2018 - Aug. 2018) Awards Excellence Award in 2017 Korea Supercomputing Challenge Jul. 27th, 2017 - Jul. 28th, 2017 Awarded by the president of KSCSE (Korean Society for Computational Science and Engineering). Excellence Award in UNIST×NAVER D2SF×LikeLion Hackathon Nov. 23rd, 2018 - Nov. 24th, 2018 Awarded by LikeLion foundation with KRW 1,000,000 (about $1,000) in prize. Semester Academic Excellence Award for three times GPA from 2017 Spring: 3.92 / 4.3 GPA from 2018 Spring: 4.10 / 4.3 GPA from 2018 Fall: 4.05 / 4.3 Academic Performance Scholarship from Mar. 2015 to Aug. 2019 Full-tuition scholarship with monthly stipend of KRW 160,000 (about $160).
